title: Google\Cloud\Spanner\Operation
name: Operation
description:
Common interface for running operations against Cloud Spanner. This class is intended for internal use by the client library only. Implementors should access these operations via Google\Cloud\Spanner\Database or Google\Cloud\Spanner\Transaction.

Usage examples may be found in classes making use of this class:

  • Google\Cloud\Spanner\Database
  • Google\Cloud\Spanner\Transaction

params.name: returnInt64AsObject
params.description: If true, 64 bit integers will be returned as a Google\Cloud\Core\Int64 object for 32 bit platform compatibility.

params.name: mutation
params.description: The mutation data, represented as a set of key/value pairs.

params.name: session
params.description: The session ID to use for the commit.

params.name: options.returnCommitStats
params.description: If true, return the full response. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.requestOptions
params.description: Request options. For more information on available options, please see the upstream documentation. Please note, if using the priority setting you may utilize the constants available on Google\Cloud\Spanner\V1\RequestOptions\Priority to set a value.

params.name: session
params.description: The session ID to use for the commit.

params.name: options.returnCommitStats
params.description: If true, return the full response. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.requestOptions
params.description: Request options. For more information on available options, please see the upstream documentation. Please note, if using the priority setting you may utilize the constants available on Google\Cloud\Spanner\V1\RequestOptions\Priority to set a value.

returns.description: An array containing Google\Cloud\Spanner\Timestamp at index 0 and the commit response as an array at index 1.

params.name: session
params.description: The session to use for the rollback. Note that the session MUST be the same one in which the transaction was created.

params.name: session
params.description: The session to use to execute the SQL.

params.name: options.requestOptions
params.description: Request options. For more information on available options, please see the upstream documentation. Please note, if using the priority setting you may utilize the constants available on Google\Cloud\Spanner\V1\RequestOptions\Priority to set a value.

methods.name: executeUpdate
methods.description: Execute a DML statement and return an affected row count.

params.name: session
params.description: The session in which the update operation should be executed.

params.name: transaction
params.description: The transaction in which the operation should be executed.

params.name: options.requestOptions
params.description: Request options. For more information on available options, please see the upstream documentation. Please note, if using the priority setting you may utilize the constants available on Google\Cloud\Spanner\V1\RequestOptions\Priority to set a value.

exceptions.description: If the SQL string isn't an update operation.

methods.name: executeUpdateBatch
methods.description:
Execute multiple DML statements.

For detailed usage instructions, see Google\Cloud\Spanner\Transaction::executeUpdateBatch().

params.name: session
params.description: The session in which the update operation should be executed.

params.name: transaction
params.description: The transaction in which the operation should be executed.

params.name: statements
params.description: A list of DML statements to run. Each statement must contain a sql key, where the value is a DML string. If the DML contains placeholders, values are provided as a key/value array in key parameters. If parameter types are required, they must be provided in key paramTypes. Generally, Google Cloud PHP can infer types. Explicit type declarations are required in the case of struct parameters, or when a null value exists as a parameter. Accepted values for primitive types are defined as constants on Google\Cloud\Spanner\Database, and are as follows: Database::TYPE_BOOL, Database::TYPE_INT64, Database::TYPE_FLOAT64, Database::TYPE_TIMESTAMP, Database::TYPE_DATE, Database::TYPE_STRING, Database::TYPE_BYTES. If the value is an array, use Google\Cloud\Spanner\ArrayType to declare the array parameter types. Likewise, for structs, use Google\Cloud\Spanner\StructType.

params.name: options.requestOptions
params.description: Request options. For more information on available options, please see the upstream documentation. Please note, if using the priority setting you may utilize the constants available on Google\Cloud\Spanner\V1\RequestOptions\Priority to set a value.

exceptions.description: If any statement is missing the `sql` key.

params.name: session
params.description: The session in which to read data.

params.name: columns
params.description: A list of column names to return.

params.name: options.index
params.description: The name of an index on the table.

params.name: options.offset
params.description: The number of rows to offset results by.

params.name: options.requestOptions
params.description: Request options. For more information on available options, please see the upstream documentation. Please note, if using the priority setting you may utilize the constants available on Google\Cloud\Spanner\V1\RequestOptions\Priority to set a value.

params.name: session
params.description: The session to start the transaction in.

params.name: options.singleUse
params.description: If true, a Transaction ID will not be allocated up front. Instead, the transaction will be considered "single-use", and may be used for only a single operation. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.isRetry
params.description: If true, the resulting transaction will indicate that it is the result of a retry operation. Defaults to false.

methods.name: createTransaction
methods.description: Create a Transaction instance from a response object.

params.name: session
params.description: The session to start the snapshot in.

params.name: options.singleUse
params.description: If true, a Transaction ID will not be allocated up front. Instead, the transaction will be considered "single-use", and may be used for only a single operation. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.className
params.description: If set, an instance of the given class will be instantiated. This setting is intended for internal use. Defaults to Google\Cloud\Spanner\Snapshot.

methods.name: createSnapshot
methods.description: Create a Snapshot instance from a response object.

params.name: className
params.description: The class to instantiate with a snapshot. Defaults to Google\Cloud\Spanner\Snapshot.

methods.name: createSession
methods.description:
Create a new session.

Sessions are handled behind the scenes and this method does not need to be called directly.

params.name: options.labels
params.description: Labels to be applied to each session created in the pool. Label keys must be between 1 and 63 characters long and must conform to the following regular expression: [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?. Label values must be between 0 and 63 characters long and must conform to the regular expression ([a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)?. No more than 64 labels can be associated with a given session. See https://goo.gl/xmQnxf for more information on and examples of labels.

methods.name: session
methods.description:
Lazily instantiates a session. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a session please see Google\Cloud\Spanner\Session\Session.

Sessions are handled behind the scenes and this method does not need to be called directly.

params.name: options.maxPartitions
params.description: The desired maximum number of partitions to return. For example, this may be set to the number of workers available. The maximum value is currently 200,000. This is only a hint. The actual number of partitions returned may be smaller than this maximum count request. Defaults to 10000.

params.name: options.partitionSizeBytes
params.description: The desired data size for each partition generated. This is only a hint. The actual size of each partition may be smaller or larger than this size request. Defaults to 1000000000 (i.e. 1 GiB).

params.name: options.parameters
params.description: A key/value array of Query Parameters, where the key is represented in the query string prefixed by a @ symbol.

params.name: options.types
params.description: A key/value array of Query Parameter types. Generally, Google Cloud PHP can infer types. Explicit type definitions are only necessary for null parameter values. Accepted values are defined as constants on Google\Cloud\Spanner\ValueMapper, and are as follows: Database::TYPE_BOOL, Database::TYPE_INT64, Database::TYPE_FLOAT64, Database::TYPE_TIMESTAMP, Database::TYPE_DATE, Database::TYPE_STRING, Database::TYPE_BYTES, Database::TYPE_ARRAY and Database::TYPE_STRUCT. If the parameter type is an array, the type should be given as an array, where the first element is Database::TYPE_ARRAY and the second element is the array type, for instance [Database::TYPE_ARRAY, Database::TYPE_INT64].

params.name: columns
params.description: A list of column names to return.

params.name: options.maxPartitions
params.description: The desired maximum number of partitions to return. For example, this may be set to the number of workers available. The maximum value is currently 200,000. This is only a hint. The actual number of partitions returned may be smaller than this maximum count request. Defaults to 10000.

params.name: options.partitionSizeBytes
params.description: The desired data size for each partition generated. This is only a hint. The actual size of each partition may be smaller or larger than this size request. Defaults to 1000000000 (i.e. 1 GiB).

params.name: options.index
params.description: The name of an index on the table.
